key_points: WSAZ's interview with Vice President Kamala Harris drew national attention after airing Thursday.
The White House responded to questions about Harris' appearance, highlighting efforts to reach Americans directly.
Sen. Joe Manchin expressed surprise and concern, emphasizing the need for bipartisan cooperation.
Press Secretary Jen Psaki explained the choice of local stations in Arizona and West Virginia for reaching out to the American public.
The American Rescue Plan (ARP) proposes $1,400 checks for Americans, which Manchin believes should be targeted to those in need.
Manchin has called for the economic relief to be more targeted, questioning the need for high earners to receive payments.
Vice President Harris emphasized the administration's commitment to all Americans, regardless of their vote.
The difference in approach to the ARP between Sen. Manchin and the Biden administration highlights intra-party debate.
Manchin highlighted that Congress has already invested $4.8 trillion in response to the pandemic, more than the entire U.S. budget.
The interview and subsequent reactions underscore ongoing discussions on how best to provide economic relief to Americans.
spokespersons: Sen. Joe Manchin (Senator from West Virginia)
